title: Computer Science Words
description: Decode the language of computing, from algorithms and data structures to programming concepts and digital technology.

questions.question: What is an 'algorithm'?
options: A step-by-step procedure for solving a problem or performing a task

questions.question: What does 'bandwidth' refer to in computing?
options: The maximum rate of data transfer across a network
The physical width of a cable
The size of a computer screen

questions.question: What is a 'byte'?
options: A unit of digital information equal to 8 bits

questions.question: What does 'debugging' mean?
options: The process of finding and fixing errors in a program

questions.question: What is 'encryption'?
options: Backing up files to the cloud
Compressing a file to save space
Converting data into a coded form to prevent unauthorized access

questions.question: What is a 'firewall' in computing?
options: A security system that monitors and controls network traffic
A type of power surge protector
A physical barrier inside a computer

questions.question: What does 'latency' mean in networking?
options: The strength of a Wi-Fi signal
The delay between sending and receiving data

questions.question: What is a 'pixel'?
options: The smallest unit of a digital image on a display

questions.question: What does 'recursion' mean in programming?
options: A function that calls itself to solve a problem

questions.question: What is 'cache' in computing?
options: A high-speed storage area that temporarily holds frequently accessed data
The main processor of a computer

questions.question: What does 'binary' refer to in computer science?
options: A number system using only 0s and 1s
A method of connecting two computers

questions.question: What is a 'compiler'?
options: A device that connects to the internet
A program that translates source code into machine-readable instructions

questions.question: What is a 'variable' in programming?
options: A fixed value that never changes
A named storage location in memory that holds a value which can change

questions.question: What is 'open source' software?
options: Software whose source code is freely available for anyone to view, modify, and distribute
Software that only runs on one operating system
